stanza.line: Weary with toil I haste me to my bedbed
The dear respose for limbs with travel tiredtired
But then begins a journey in my headhead
To work my mind when body work expiredexpired
For then my thoughts (from far where I abide)abide)
Intend a zealous pilgrimage to theethee
And keep my drooping eyelids open widewide
Looking on darkness which the blind do seesee
Save that my soul imaginary sightsight
Presents thy shadow to my sightless viewview
Which like a jewel (hung in ghastly night)night)
Makes black night beauteous and her old face newnew
Lo thus by day my limbs by night my mindmind
For thee and for my self no quiet findfind
